definition: a stiff or threatening gait, walk stiffly
details:
noun
- a stiff or threatening gait
= synonyms: angry walk
- the act of following prey stealthily
= synonyms: stalking
- a hunt for game carried on by following it stealthily or waiting in ambush
= synonyms: stalking, still hunt
- a slender or elongated structure that supports a plant or fungus or a plant part or plant organ
= synonyms: stem
- material consisting of seed coverings and small pieces of stem or leaves that have been separated from the seeds
= synonyms: straw, chaff, stubble, husk, shuck
verb
- walk stiffly
- go through (an area) in search of prey
= example: go through (an area) in search of prey
- follow stealthily or recur constantly and spontaneously to
= example: follow stealthily or recur constantly and spontaneously to
= synonyms: haunt
